Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: 10acmel
Reviews.Content: We paid 169/ night to stay here, which was half the price of places on the beach. Yet we never felt far from the action. Key Biscayne, little Havana, Coral Gables, downtown are all only minutes away. Plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance as well. Add to this free parking. The free breakfast was varied and plentiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful in suggesting ways for us to get around time. The cons? A cold pool and slow Internet. But overall an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: KMP53
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and the hotel was very clean and pleasant. The staff is helpful and the continental breakfasts are delicious. Traffic is heavy as the hotel sits along US 1, but still, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice & affordable”
Reviews.Author: itsok4me
Reviews.Content: a good room, a good complimentary breakfast and free parking. What else could you ask for at that rate?

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, as expected”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: This is my generic review of a Hampton Inn property. Clean, good service, good complementary breakfast. Everything I expect at a Hampton Inn with no surprises. They're generally all the same. This Miami - Coconut Grove property seems to be a little on the older side.

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: Natalya T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn Coconut Grove for 6 days during our vacation. Location is perfect. Close to everything:Downtown, South beach, Keys, Shopping malls.....very convenient. Room was clean upon check in and was serviced daily by housekeeping very well. Complimentary breakfast and managers reception were above and beyond of usual "Hampton style" breakfast. They had different hot items every day thru all our stay!! lots of food.... Staff was very welcoming and made us feel warm thru all our stay..... We appreciated everything so much! Thank you guys for such a great work!!!! P.S. internet was super slow though....but we didnt need to use it a lot, cause we were out of hotel most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service level for type of hotel (2* star eqvlt)”
Reviews.Author: TahitiTurtle
Reviews.Content: Excellent low-to-mid-range option. good location and parking facilities. service level impressively at a level of 4*+ hotels. breakfast is of the uninspiring kind without substance so typical for this type of hotel, but even on that aspect one feels they put in some effort. Recommendable if a little expensive for Hampton Inns. I reckon this is driven by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mariam A
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a nicer room, and the front desk attendant called me five minutes after I got into my room to make sure the accommodations were acceptable. Everyone that worked at the hotel was very pleasant and made sure I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buzzaway
Reviews.Content: Located very close to Coconut Grove tri rail station but a bit far to walk to downtown Coconut Grove. Very clean hotel. Super breakfast included as part of the deal. At Hampton Inn they include breakfast, coffee, wifi, pool, parking and business centre. Consequently it's quite pricey unless you plan to use all of these features. Management failed to respond to a call related to a maintenance and noise issue which was disappointing. I walked to front desk and they sorted it out straight away - pity the manager couldn't be bothered coming to see me and sorting it out personally. Our room had microwave and fridge but they don't all have these. Room don't have safes which is a real miss.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: hokiedad_7
Reviews.Content: Spent one night touring Miami and were very pleased with this Hampton Inn. The facility was very up to date with a surprisingly modern room. Good digital thermostat AC, a very modern bath, bigscreen TV and quiet. The entire staff was helpful and pleasant during our stay. The free parking is a plus and there are good restaurants within a block or two (we had a great Cuban meal at Las Culebrines). The walk to Coconut grove is about 10 - 15 min and we felt safe during our stay. The location is just off Dixie Highway so there is no road noise. A very good value and convenient to Coral Gables, Vizcaya, Coconut Grove, Fairchild Gardens and Little Havana.

Reviews.Title: “convenient place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: srubin5190
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Miami for two nights before heading down to Key West. This hotel offered a convenient, comfortable and reasonable place to stay. The hotel is within walking distance (about 20 minutes) to downtown Coconut Grove. (recommend Jaguar's restaurant) and across Route 1 from Metrorail. There are two nice restaurants around the corner. Berry's and a Cuban restaurant. We ate at both and were quite pleased with the food. The hotel was clean and offered a decent breakfast. I enjoyed the oatmeal with toppings. It was a bit hard to find, as it is tucked away on a smaller street, but we turned around on US 1. Parking was provided. As to flying into Miami before heading to Key West with a rented car. If possible, fly into Key West. You won't need a car once you get there. Oh, one more thing....I loved the shower. They converted the tubs into stall showers, and as I have back problems, I was able to get in and out with no problem. The bottom of the stall was non-stick. We always put a small bath mat in our luggage, but we didn't need to use it!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Seat13F
Reviews.Content: Very close to Coconut Grove shops and restaurants. Large room. Breakfast is included. Internet is sloooooowww.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Pvblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed while visiting the University of Miami, it's less than 3 miles away, Beds and room very comfortable, everything sparkling clean. Managers"happy hour" with wine, beer, soft drinks and nice snacks, 6-7pm a nice touch! Reception personnel so friendly and gave great advice. Walking distance to great Cuban-Spanish restaurant Las Culebrinas. Shell gas station across the street (to gas up before returning to airport, very convenient!) close to nice shopping and coconut grove sailing club. Didn't use the pool, but it loIke's nice, not big area but enough to lounge if so inclined. Small exercise room next to pool, ok for a quick work out to start the day, nobody else was there when I used it. Highly reccommend if going to coral gables or coconut grove area! Free parking and nice free breakfast, even to go if in a hurry are great pluses!

Reviews.Title: “An average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for the first time. This was a 2 night stay before we boarded a crusie out of Port of Miami. The locations was good, not too far from the airport or the cruise terminal. The big plus was the fact that parking was free, not like the Hampton Inns near the ocean. The level of service was standard. it was very helpful that the Coral Gables/Coconut Groves businesses were a short drive from the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Went to Miami for the Marathon and this was our best choice. We walk to the train station and took it to downtown where the marathon was going to start. It has everything you need, coffee 24 hrs, free breakfast, free wifi, clean rooms, free parking lot, don't need anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: SergeOttawa
Reviews.Content: We recentrly stayed 4 nights at the Hampton Inn in Coconut Grove and were very satisfied. The room and bathroom were very nice and the breakfast was great with different hot items every morning. One minor complain about breakfast. All the cold cereals were sugary and my wife likes All Bran or Cheerios which don't have sugar. Another complain was that the high-speed was not high-speed the 4 days we were there. I tested it and it was closer to dial-up and I complained about it. I was told it was being worked on. I also heard another couple complain about it too. On the positive side, the hotel in 1 block (yes 1 block) from the Coconut Grove Metrorail station. We could get to downtown very easily. If the internet had worked corectly, I would have given it the 5 circles.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled8346
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn in Coconut Grove is very clean, free wi-fi, free continental breakfast, has a swimming pool, free business center which came in handy several times, and a 24 hour fitness room and also free parking which is very accessible. The rooms were small but clean and the bed very comfortable. The room came with a coffee maker, a refrigerator and microwave which we utilized all of those services. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location was ideal as I was so close to Port Of Miami and within walking distance of several good restaurants and shops. Very easy and close to almost every destination we needed to go. Traffic was not bad at all. Very good hotel and a good area for the price. I have stayed in much more expensive name brand hotels where the service was worse. I would recommend to anyone and would stay here again. I also am a smoker which smoking was not allowed in the rooms which I enjoy b/c I don't enjoy the smell but there were smoking area balconies on each floor that were easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: We came into Miami for the Miami marathon it was a great hotel for the location a block away from the train station to get to downtown in the morning and we did everything okay

Reviews.Title: “Great hote for Miami”
Reviews.Author: SharkyCornwall
Reviews.Content: Located just off the US1 and near the metro that takes you downtown. Coco walk is a 15 minute walk away. Hotel is well equipped and spotless. Contrary to previous post front of house was efficient and very friendly. Free parking and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Middling.”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadLinni
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine; room was clean, location was ok, breakfast staff were very helpful and pleasant. However, the front desk staff weren't very friendly. That does make a difference to how your stay goes and can change an average stay to a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms and breakfast, everything else sub par”
Reviews.Author: pritch0613
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hampton Inn for two weeks while in the area on business. Rooms were standard and fairly large. Breakfast was a little better than the standard Hampton Inn breakfast, they had a couple extra options that I don't normally see, and breakfast seating area was very large. Location is good -- close to Coconut Grove, Metrorail, and University of Miami. The fitness center needs improvement. Treadmill had a large dent in the plastic under the belt which I could feel while running; the software on the elliptical did not work, so I could only use it at one resistance level (no resistance) and could not track my time or progress on the machine. Parking is odd -- there is an open air lot, and below that there is a deck which did not seem safe. The open air lot was narrow and filled up quickly at night. Customer service was lacking. Staff seemed annoyed by standard requests. Would be an okay hotel for a one-time trip to the area, but I would not recommend this property for multiple stays.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is better than other Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: Racandtac
Reviews.Content: You know what you get with this chain but we felt this one went the extra mile in customer service and friendliness. The room we were first given had such loud air conditioner that kept shutting off and restarting. Next day it was serviced by the leading technician. A nicer man you would not meet. He got us moved to a new room with a whisper quiet aircon. He also checked with us the next two days to ensure everything was going ok. Breakfast was of a better standard than we experienced in other Hampton Inns, the fresh fruit was available all day and of a good quality. Free parking is always a bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterOdgaard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a Florida road trip. The hotel and rooms were nice and clean. The bed was were good. The breakfast was the best "free" breakfast I have ever had on a hotel in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EyeCandy00
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid Hampton Inn customer. This hotel was ok compared to the rest we've stayed in. It was also more expensive but considering that it was in Coral Gables, you couldn't get a better price anywhere else nearby in Miami. The hotel is a little old fashioned, old fittings etc., the lamps by the beds in my room (401) had short circuits but we didn't let that bug us too much. I liked that it was a coin laundry service so we didn't have to travel back home with a bunch of dirty clothing! The breakfast was ok, nice selections, the breakfast staff were AMAZING! By far, the most courteous bunch of ladies, always keeping their eye open if anything was running out and very quick to clean up any spills (i made a BIG one by the waffle maker) and they were so kind and polite. I'm sorry I didn't get their names but they all deserve a raise! The parking lot near the lobby was very small, we'd try to get back at a decent hour so we didn't have to park downstairs where our car was out of view. I didn't like that too much.The front staff was also helpful. I was expecting a FedEx package and they happily accepted on my behalf, no problems or additional cost at all. That service was very accommodating to me It's a little far away from all the nice shopping etc. maybe like 15-20 minutes away. We were used to staying at the Howard Johnson in Hialeah which was cheaper and was mere feet away from nice shopping, but the service was no where near as good as the Hampton Inn. We did some major shopping and also packed large items to ship back home and used the trolleys back and forth with our boxes etc. to our leisure. No one looked at us funny or gave us any problems or asked what we were doing. Late nights we would see a policeman/security at the front desk, not sure why but I can only assume maybe they got robbed late in the night already? I'm speculating, I'm really not sure. Overall, I'd recommend for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night after flying in from Minnesota for a trip down to Key West. Room was very nice and quite large. Walked to a cuban restaturant just east of the hotel. Seemed like a safe area. Good complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Super value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Donh67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central to everything. Go north to Miami beaches, west to everglade national park, and south to Miami zoo and key west. Free parking and breakfast, even free buffet dinner! Just can't believe it! We came here on the eve of Thanksgiving and were encountered by a staff in the elevator when we went out for dinner and were told they decided to serve the dinner buffet for free. The spicy chicken wing are delicious, plus the dessert and beer, even red wine. A big surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton right next to Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: JM_2793
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel. Lots of parking, clean fresh rooms. Good breakfast and sometimes evening snacks. Helpful staff. Easy walk to Coconut Grove restaurants and there is a great Spanish restaurant around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Coral Gables, Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: johco
Reviews.Content: Good Value in Coral Gables, Coconut Grove. This is actually a good central location for a visit to the Miami area. Short trip to Coconut Grove shopping area, Coral Gables, Biltmore Hotel, Viscaya, Key Biscayne. Maybe 20 minutes from downtown, 30 minutes from South Beach. Free parking and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that gets everything right”
Reviews.Author: RatnWres
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really impressive Good sized rooms, a plentiful breakfast and on two of the evenings we stayed there an evening reception of snacks and beers / wines all for free! Visitors to the hotel should check out berries for excellent food, drink and atmosphere Coconut grove itself is a 15 minute walk away

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: AlexG71
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the hotel. Rooms are big, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included in the rate and was quite good, too. Unfortunately the staff at the reception could be more friendly (at least say good-morning when you get at the desk..) and the we would like to use the swimming pool outdoor but the water was really dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, clean, friendly...great location”
Reviews.Author: casaransom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in its class. It is economical, but the location is 5 star! The rooms are clean and the beds amazingly comfortable. There is even a small pool on location. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Resaonable Rates!”
Reviews.Author: dmichaelmiller
Reviews.Content: This is just about the nicest Hampton Inn I've stayed at, and I've stayed at quite a few. It is extremely well located if you have business in downtown Miami or Coconut Grove. The rates are very reasonable, especially if you ask for an AAA discount or AARP. Lobby is very clean, rooms are immaculate, breakfast is plentiful and dining area is big enough to serve everybody. Parking lot has two levels and is very secure. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlanner_01
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice, comfortable, and affordable hotel in Miami for a business trip. Although my company pays for my stay, I never like to choose a hotel that's too pricey. As I began my search, hotel rooms in the area were going for a premium and availability was surprisingly not good. As it turned out, the couple nights I stayed just happened to be when the X Factor was filming in Miami. I really had planned to stay on South Beach since that is where my meeting was, but the cost was prohibitive. I expanded my search and found this Hampton Inn which had a reasonable rate so I booked the room. What a great decision! Besides being comfortable and clean, it's really in a great location. It was a short drive over to South Beach each morning, and since I seemed to be moving against traffic, it was much faster than I expected. It was also within walking distance of a few restaurants so I didn't need to drive anywhere for dinner which is a big plus for me. I felt perfectly safe walking in the area. Parking is free; however, the lot on the street level is a little tight on space. With a small rental car, it wasn't a big deal, but a larger vehicle might have some difficulty backing out. There are also spaces below the street level, but I never had to park down there. Overall, I would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ViajanteBrasilia1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just perfect. The staff were really kindness . There were free parking, free wifi, amazing free breakfast and a wonderful snack on the afternoon . The room were big enough and the the beds were really confortable. Definilly , I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: lishane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location for the Coconut Grove area of Miami. You are a short drive from Versailles if you are interested in great Cuban food, a short drive from/to the airport and to Key Biscayne. There are a few good places to eat in the area, nothing fancy, but good. They only complaint would be that the pool is small, hard to find, and completely shaded.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here to move in to the U”
Reviews.Author: ljayglover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 days while moving my freshman son into the U. If you're looking for a place to stay close to the school, and you're not looking for a resort hotel, this is the place. It's clean, easy to get around to places, and has very good free parking. Bathrooms were recently re-done, so they're very nice. We had a refrigerator and microwave too. Pool is small but functional, and they have a few tables to relax at out there too. The only negative I saw was the front help desk. They always seemed to be more concerned about what was going on behind the counter, instead of in front of the counter. Luckily, I didn't need them after check in. We realized at the end of the visit that it's very close to the Grove, a popular area with restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Service”
Reviews.Author: StogieTbg
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel in a very nice area. Only thing is it's not near the beach and it's a bit of a walk to the Coconut Walk shoipping area. aslo there is no shuttle service to/from the airport or Port of Miami. The service was great and they had the regular Hampton Inn breakfast and each night, they had a nice appetizer mealk with beer or wine for guests as well. This was a great place to stay and very friendly. The Pollo restaurant across the street was great for a fast food restaurant. large grills with lots of caribbean/spanish foods. We really enjoyed the place and thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: muetterof4
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we found it to be very comfortable. The rooms were very clean and updated. Nice bedding, flat screen tv, remodeled bathrooms. The air smells clean and fresh in the room. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast and wireless is a bonus, and free parking. It seems like quite the deal for this nice area. We will be using this hotel a lot as our daughter is a freshman at U of Miami. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Practical option in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Noella B
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for a conference in South Beach and decided to stay in this Hampton Inn for practicality. The rates were very reasonable and the hotel was 20 minutes away from South Beach. The room was nice and clean. The beds were clean and comfortable. The meals were typical of the Hampton Inn breakfasts. The women tending to the breakfast area were nice and courteous. They were on the ball and were always refilling the containers and cleaning the tables and providing good service. That was the extent of the good service. The front desk was not as helpful. When we checked in, we thought the rooms came with a refrigerator and microwave, at least the website seemed to say so. When we got there, the front desk said that was not the case. If we wanted, they could put what we have in a main refrigerator that only the employees have access to. I guess that was nice, it would have been nicer to have more options. That seems to be the extent of their service. We used the vending machines and the laundry facilities and they weren't working too well either. The bottle got stuck in the machine and the front desk said that was too bad. We should try fishing for it with a ruler or something. In other words, it was our problem, not theirs. In the laundry facility, the dryer didn't work. We reported it to the front desk and they said, "try the other one." Again, it was our problem, not theirs. To summarize, I think this is a practical option in Miami. The rooms are nice and comfy. Parking is ample. They even have an underground garage, which was nice in the hot weather. Service though, in general, could be much better. I've stayed in a lot of Hampton Inns and this probably was the Hampton Inn that would rate lowest in terms of service (except for the breakfast area). Hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Smart and practical hotel option in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Rictest
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, good location in south Miami and complimentary conveniences as parking and breakfest. We spent 10 days here for shopping and vactioning and were very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than we Expected!”
Reviews.Author: traveltrini
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 4th - 7th July. We did not realize how close it was to coconut grove and Peacock Park. Really enjoyed the 4th of July fireworks at the Marina. No need to look for parking, as it is a short walk. Also had an opportunity to try the Food Trucks, those were great also. We really love staying at Hampton, the price is good, and we love the breakfast and free internet. It really is a good deal. For Hilton Honors members you can get special rates, so look into that as well. The staff was exceptionally pleasant, especially the breakfast staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AlexR05
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean. Staff is friendly. Good high speed internet. Generous and diverse breakfast. Hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for The U”
Reviews.Author: Huntersville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during a college visit to The University of Miami. Pretty good value, free parking, excellent breakfast. Pretty quick trip to the university, and a short drive (or 15 min walk) to Coconut Grove shops & restaurants. Since we selected the university, we'll be coming back over the next 4 years!

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: sitraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from this hotel, but was nicely surprised once I entered my room. It was quite spacious and very clean. The toilettries provided were very nice! Although the location isn't the best if you want to stay near downtown or south beach, if you have a car, your problem is solved! The breakfast was excellent, with many options! We loved it! The pool is very tiny, so don't go there expecting too much. The service is nice, but don't expect to have a concierge at your disposal. The front desk is there to help you with the essencial, don't expect much more than that. The grounds are a bity noisy for my taste, as I could hear my neighbor shut the door very vigourosly at night, or people knocking on his door constantly (maybe you have a silent neighbor, and you'll be luckier than us)! All in all, we liked the hotel, would recommend it if you're expecting a nice cost, a clean room to spend the night, free parking and wi-fi internet. In Miami, it's almost a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative location to South Beach and Miami City”
Reviews.Author: Patch007London
Reviews.Content: We were originally planning to stay somewhere in South Beach for our last 2 nights of our Floriday holiday but, after reading some scary reviews by other Trip Advisors, decided to stay slightly outside. And we are really glad we did. Our room was comfortable and clean - good value for the money we paid - and breakfast was typical of a Hampton - cereals, yogurts, hot choices etc.etc. You would certainly not go hungry. Also, again typical of most American hotels, coffee and tea available in the Reception area 24/7. There is not much to do/see close to the hotel but a 20 min. walk will take you to Coco Walk which was great. A little "mall" with some good restaurants and bars -music everywhere. There is also a good restaurant no more than 10 mins. walk from the hotel which we can thoroughly recommend. Just across the street from the hotel is the railway line which we took to Government Centre, then a 5 min. walk to the bus terminal, and a bus to South Beach. The whole journey took about 1 hr. We are glad we didn't drive as parking and traffic a nightmare and it was also a good way to see things. South Beach itself, frankly, we thought a bit of a rip-off - presumably you go to see and to be seen!! I am sure it comes into its own at night though - but we are still glad we didn't stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for UM graduation.”
Reviews.Author: AuntKaren
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn when in Miami for my nephews college graduation. We had a wonderful visit, the hotel had decorated for the occasion and had a reception for the guests attending the graduation as well as the usual free breakfast. The location was perfect for the University as well for some lovely restaurants and shopping in Coconut Grove. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, economical and clean”
Reviews.Author: Jim_bris
Reviews.Content: Good location close to highway, gas station, Miami sights etc. Beds are comfy - not sure about the pillows though. AC a little noisy by kept room cool. Nice bathroom but vanity sink bench is way too high (we are not all basketball players!!!). Friendly service, OK breakfast, free parking and WiFi. No refrigerator in room was probably the only real fault I could comment on as far as the room goes. A definite business feel, but still friendly enough for a leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: jrcaqua
Reviews.Content: i was looking very forward to my business trip to the south Florida area, but the trip unfortunately had to be postponed. I had shipped several packages to this hotel (for work) and I can't say enough what a huge help Sandy and staff were in promptly returning everything. They were very professional and so helpful. I look forward to staying at this property next time I'm in the area. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value”
Reviews.Author: suzannekees
Reviews.Content: We would def. stay at this hotel again.... superb value for the price , friendly staff,clean and comfortable , close to Coco walk, Key Biscayne etc.There are plenty of good restaurants close by plus a very nice supermarket(Millems? next to Home Depot), the breakfast buffet was very good, on the go snack bags, 24 hr.coffee and tea PLUS we enjoyed a complimentery evening buffet ( incl.cold beer and wine ....the red wine was delicious) for all guests between 17-19 pm . Hampton Inn is now at the top of our list .!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Value For Your Dollar”
Reviews.Author: healinghart
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently and was very impressed. ' PROS Check in was smooth, staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel is very clean nicely maintained and very accomodating. Rooms were clean , nicely furnished , nice comfy beds and linens. Rooms also had flat screen tv , air condition you could control, and free WIFI which is always a plus. Hotel also has a small pool area , small fitness area and small business center. Daily Complimentary breakfast every morning was a great perk. They also provided on the go snacks in the morning as well as Happy Hour twice a week. Parking was also free and though the lot did get full especially during late night hours, the hotel staff was very accomodating and provided permits which allowed you to park right outside of the hotel. Check out was smooth & room was cleaned daily . Hotel was about a ten minute drive to beach , 5 minute drive to night life in coconut grove.COns : bed size felt small. All in all i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, quiet king room......”
Reviews.Author: jakirh
Reviews.Content: The heading says it all, and free breakfast and parking to boot. Its located near Biscayne Bay where you can do a lot of water activities (~ 10 min away), downtown is 15 min and Miami beach is about the same. Loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: BuddyPR
Reviews.Content: Great bang for the buck. No views but convenient to downtown Coconut grove. Nice clean rooms, superior service, decent breakfast. Parking included with no fee- a real plus! Cookies and coffee all day long with a full hot breakfast included in the AM. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend Hampton Inn at Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: travelri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn for 6 nights in March 2011. I really enjoyed staying here. Check in and check out - Both were very quick Staff - All of the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to answer any questions Room - The room was very large. I had a king size bed, flat screen TV, nice big bathroom, sitting area and desk, refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. The room was very clean and quiet Location - The hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport. There are a few fast food restaurants and other restaurants near by. Coco walk is about a 10 minute walk away and there is a shuttle bus that goes there for 25 cents each way. I wish there were a few more restaurants or stores in the area. Parking - parking is free which is a plus Business room - There is a business room with 2 nice PC's with free Internet access. Pool and Gym - Both the pool and gym were small but were fine for my short stay. Breakfast - There was a wonderful full breakfast both hot and cold daily from 6-10. Also they had free coffee all day and a fruit basket consisting of bananas, apples and oranges. I enjoyed staying here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleasant staff...I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: NFB-418
Reviews.Content: Clean room, friendly staff, self parking (garage)...overall a good mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: 3hundrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before riding to Key West. Hotel was clean and convenient. Check in was quick and the desk clerk was happy to recommend some nearby restaurants. Complimentary breakfast had lots of variety and was just what we needed. Would definitely stay here again. About a $25 taxi ride from the airport and right around the corner from a fun place to eat called Berries on the Grove.

Reviews.Title: “On Par with other Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: You won't be surprised or disappointed. This is standard Hampton Inn. Free parking and free internet are nice bonuses. Manager's reception in the evening included hot and cold items, lots of fruit and veggies (as well as high fat other stuff), beer and wine. Breakfast was what every Hampton Inn serves. My room was nice, and I did not have the issue others had with the shower (I had a standard tub/shower/curtain set up). One bad thing: The chair at the desk is HORRIBLE and if you have to sit for any length and do work on your computer, it will probably bother your back. It is just a basic straight back chair with a thin bit of cushioning. One suggestion if you are making a reservation: Request a high floor. The hotel is near a busy street, and I was lucky to be on the top floor. I am guessing lower floors would be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not what I expect from Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: suchna
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for conference which was the Biltmore Hotel, But i stayed at the Hampton Inn. I thought it was okay but not worth $$. The first night I walked into a room with and old man it it, then went back down to get another room, the room they gave me had a rolloway in it. I called the front desk he suggested I move it out so that persons reservation could have it. The second night i asked to be moved because it was near the business center and the door slammed in the hallway all night... The whole thing wasnt worth the price, the manager did give me 1 nights stay reiumbursed but I just was expecting alot since its a hampton inn. Thats all not looking to get anything. I am going to coconut grove this year actually next week thats what made me think of writing this review. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but only double beds”
Reviews.Author: victoriabts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise. It was clean and very quiet, with a nice pool/hot tub and a good breakfast. Our only complaint was that we needed a room with two queen beds and they don't have any. We had two double beds instead, a bit tight for a family of four. . you can get a room with one king though. Staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jerseyguy405
Reviews.Content: I was in town for 2 nights on business. My room was large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. You can't ask for much more than that. Check in and check out was effortless. The staff was friendly and polite. There are some good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well as some fast food and a convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap good sleep Miami”
Reviews.Author: shaquelle_la_01
Reviews.Content: Hi We did 3 three night stay in Miami. The question was either to stay in one of the overprized hotels at Miami Beach or find one more budget and still good. My choise came to the Hampton Inn Coconut Grove. Good location, easy to reach from the airport, "FREE PARKING" (very important considering the high parking fees at Miami Beach). The Hotel was good Hampton standard - clean with a remodeled bath room. Bed was also good and what else do you want. You have your Hampton breakfast (if you like or dislike) and some evenings a manager reception with snacks and beverages. The value for money is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jsalazar62
Reviews.Content: Great service. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Nice place, quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “"A Hard Days Night"....”
Reviews.Author: wclaar
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and have stayed at many Hampton Inn's, but I have not and will not stay at a Hampton Inn again. This hotel has gone down-hill so badly. Management is crazy the shower head is located at the back of the shower in the space a bath tub use to occupy. The wall of the shower is outside of where the bathtub wall would have been this makes it impossible to reach in and turn on the water and wait for it to get warm. You have to walk into the shower to turn the shower on and will be sprayed with cold water the hotel has no suggestions on how to avoid this. The food has gone down-hill. The management has a team of "Breakfast Nazi's" that will follow you around and watch what you pick up and put on your plate as to imply that they are counting this is very annoying. Their were gummy and sticky, all over the surfaces that were not the flat top of tables and counters. From the telephone to the drawer knobs to the remote controls everything was filthy. When I spoke to management about my displeasure they told me that they had done their best and that there was nothing else that they could do for me. Hampton Inn has a 100% guarantee if you are not satisfied, but you will never see a dime from this Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: LynnetteB
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel- except that the beds seemed like doubles instead of queens. Beautiful room, large flat screen tv, wi-fi. Breakfast was the best we ever had at a hotel! My son thought the breakfast was better then we have at restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WifeofMiner
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, breakfast bar great, beds wonderful, close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean enough for me”
Reviews.Author: McHerrin
Reviews.Content: This property did not seem like a Hampton Inn. The shower had several hairs in it. After taking a shower, it was easy to understand why. The design of the walk-in shower was awful. I cannot imagine the difficulty it poses for the housekeeping staff. The water faucet is on the far inside -- impossible to reach without getting wet. With the exception of the duvet, the room really didn't look like a Hampton. The walls were scuffed and needed painting. The furniture was old and worn. Yes, the parking is free, but you may end up on the lower level (from the street). If so, it is a cramped one-way in/same-way out underground lot. Make sure you unloaded everything you need because you will end up walking back up the ramp to the hotel entry. I really wish this property was better kept. It is in an interesting area. The room was large and had a microwave/refrigerator. If you stay in a double room, you'll have a bathtub. That would probably be much cleaner. That's probably the best advice I can give.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: genetono
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room are very clean, breakfast is great, nice free parking and staff are very profissional and friendly. location is great, some places to eat at walking distance. or at a short drinving distance. very close to train station so we can go to downtown. convenient to drive to the zoo. i would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkleMiami
Reviews.Content: This was the cleanest Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in. The location is close to the beach and is very close to the University of Miami and to Dadeland Mall. CocoWalk is very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not so close”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: Booked based on the reviews, and did not think the hotel was convenient to anything but traffic. while there are two restaurants around the corner, including a pretty good Cuban, nothing else is close. It is a long walk to Coconut grove/Coconut Walk not a short stroll as suggested. I guess age is revelant. The traffic is intense and once parked we had no desire to move our car. I love Hampton Inn's but this is far from the best although very clean. The older style AC compressor was quite noisy and interrupted our sleep. We will return to Hampton Inns, Gold member, but not this one

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: Dick_and_Ann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights upon returning from the Keys. Good location as it is about a 15 min. drive to the airport and about 20 min. to South Beach. Thought this was one of the better Hampton Inns that we've stayed at (hard to find a really bad one though). Price was quite reasonable. Nice, mid-priced restaurant around the corner. Found the internet service in the business center to very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor beds”
Reviews.Author: annsh
Reviews.Content: We were in Miami for the Orange Bowl and stayed at this hotel. The location is good for restaurants and night life, but the room was small and the beds (2 doubles) slanted to the middle. The comforters were lumpy; too many washings and the fiberfill did not stay in place. The room did not have a microwave nor mini-fridge. Breakfast was a bit above the usual continental served at Hampton Inn. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Miami”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Choosed to stay 3 nights at the Hampton Inn for the end of the year based on the TA'sreview and the price. It was unbeatable. Has free breakfast (quite busy), free parking (also covered garage) and free in-room wifi access. Room was quiet on 6th floor. King size bed, flat TV, desk and chair, refrigerator, no bath but shower only. Staff was helpful and nice. Pool at the back and fitness room also available. Just a few minutes away from CocoWalk for restaurants and shops by car. From Downtown Miami and South Beach it's more 20 to 30 minutes by car depending on traffic. 1 day, they didn't service our room as hotel was full and we've just asked for fresh towels. Will surely come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Gitano
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay. Not perfect but good. Rooms very well maintained. Has SELF PARKING which virtually no hotel in south beach does. Stay here and pay 1/3 of the south beach prices. Breakfast basic but good. Staff pretty friendly. The downsides are it is not close to much to walk to so you need to get in your car and drive, but again, for the money savings I didn't mind. The parking lot is a little cramped but no big deal. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Knoxvoltn
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this Hampton Inn and it was a great experience. It's a very, very nice Hampton Inn. The rooms are very quiet, I never heard our neighbors. The facility is very modern and they are actually renovating it currently. Also, the staff is friendly. The bed and pillows were not very comfortable, both my wife and I had trouble getting comfortable on the bed. The air conditioner works very well to keep the room cool (which is very important in Miami!), but it's also quite loud. The hotel's 24-hour fitness center has a descent treadmill and a fairly good cross-trainer/elliptical machine, but it is otherwise not very good (I'm big time into fitness, so my standards are very high). The fitness center has no free weights and a few machines (which I didn't use). The floor leaves very little room for someone to stretch, do abs, etc. The entire room is only big enough for about 3 people to be in at the same time (although, as small as it is, I felt a little awkward with one other person in the room). There is only one TV and no headphones, so try to get there early so you will have it to yourself. The desirability of the location will depend on your goals. The hotel is about one block off US Highway 1 (a/k/a "Useless 1"), which has very bad traffic just about constantly. We had an appointment in Coconut Grove, so this hotel was perfect for us. Also, we love the Miami Zoo and this location is fairly close to the zoo as far as distance (but, again, you have to deal with US-1 traffic). If you're heading to the beaches, Hallandale, Sunny Isles, etc., then this location might not be the best for you. Finally, this location has free self-parking! That's very nice in Miami, especially if you're used to staying at the beaches. The area seems fairly safe, but I wouldn't leave valuables in the car or be out too late at night/early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Well-maintained, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CJBNJ
Reviews.Content: We had read horrible reviews about other hotels in the area. This was the ONLY one that had consistently good reviews. We chose this hotel because of the reviews and the distance to my daughter's apartment (coral gables), her school (UMiami) and points of interest. LOVED IT! Even with the good reviews, we were a little apprehensive but no need. The place is immaculate, including the pool and hot tub area. Above and under ground parking (accessed by key) is well-lit. The hot breakfast, while not the greatest, was included. One morning it was scrambled eggs and sausage gravy & biscuit, the next morning it was french toast and sausage. If you didn't wish to partake of the hot food, there was cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, muffins, toast. Bed was very comfortable. I told my daughter to recommend this hotel to other family/friends that may come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean accomodations with a warm and hospitable staff.”
Reviews.Author: kreb
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I loved the location--it seemed to be close to everything and walking distance to the shops in Coconut Grove. I was able to spend a few hours relaxing at the pool one afternoon and I found it well maintained and nicely landscaped. Even though I was here on business, I really enjoyed my stay at the Coconut Grove Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Nice”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: A pleasant 2 night stay stay. Good value for the money especially with breakfast included. Relatively safe location and with plenty of low cost restaurants close by. Try Pollo Tropical directly opposite the hotel for a welcome change from the usual fast food fare. Parking was convenient, safe, off-street and free. A short drive from the airport (MIA) and a straightforward, if longer, drive to Beaches and the Art Deco district. Plenty of malls within a 15 minute drive and easy access to the road to the Everglades. Breakfast was good with hot items, toast, cereals, juice, coffee etc. Desk staff were efficient. Quick check in and out and very helpful advice about where to go and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN TOWN”
Reviews.Author: TTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very clean rooms and all areas, nice facilities. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs Are Real”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler_CC
Reviews.Content: The free breakfast is the best part of the stay ... there is a wide variety of food and beverage choices and some of the items rotate day to day so you don't get offered the same stuff. The staff is very attentive and professional and hardworking. The hotel is in a pretty good spot, but you'll need to drive ... there's not much within walking distance. The A/C can be VERY loud, so bring earplugs. Worst of all, I got 28 bites from bed bugs. Yes, I found out they are real. I confirmed it was bed bugs from this hotel without a doubt. Think of misquito bites times 100. Research them online and you'll know the pain and discomfort I'm (still) in. I notified the hotel, but didn't trust that enough was done, so I slept the last two nights fully clothed (socks on hands, etc.) with all the lights on. I'll have to leave the suitcases and their contents outside when I get home so I can start the process of taking care of these rascals so they won't invade my house. I spread medicinal creme on half of my trip and beyond and was miserable. All hotel pools should be heated (you don't have to turn it on all year), and this one is further proof. The pool is about 10 by 20 feet, but fairly deep on one end. Keep your socks on in the rooms, then throw them away, as you'll notice they'll get black from the carpet. Yeah, juck. Housekeeping is very weak at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Choice in South Miami”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: I had a trip to visit the campus of the University of Miami, and I needed a room for two nights. I wanted a hotel near the campus so I could avoid some of the morning traffic. I also wanted a decent rate (in a typically overpriced area) and a clean room. I have made several trips to the campus, and have had mixed success on finding a room that fits those needs. On several previous trips here I stayed at a Ramada Inn near the Dadeland Mall, as I reported in other reviews, but that hotel is no longer a Ramada, nor does it offer economical rates. I was not impressed by the reviews of several other hotels and motels near the campus, so I extended the radius for my search. The Hampton Inn Coconut Grove was available for about $120 per night. It's a few miles from campus. It's also north of the campus, which meant I would be opposing the heavier morning traffic flow. I reserved two nights using the non-refundable rate to save a little money. I do not like non-refundable rates, but I was fairly certain my plans would not change. The hotel is easy to access from South Dixie Highway (US1). Because US1cuts diagonally through the square grid street layout of Miami, there are some odd traffic patterns on the side streets. You can se the hotel from US1, but it is possible to miss the turn into the hotel. When I arrived, I received a friendly greeting, and I checked in quickly. My room was clean and comfortable. It was a typical size with two queen beds. The room includes breakfast (biscuits, scrambled egg patties, ham, yogurt, fruit, bagels, juice, coffee, etc.) like other Hampton Inns. The breakfast area was clean and well maintained. There was also a guest reception the night I checked in, and beer, wine, soda and snacks were served. The hotel has two parking areas. One is open at al times. The other is a secured garage that requires a room key to access. I parked in the garage both nights, and I felt my car was safe. The hotel offers free high-speed Internet, both wired and wireless. Access was reliable and quick. The Coconut Grove Metrorail station is two blocks away. There are a few small groceries and mini marts nearby, as well as a gas station and some convenience restaurants. The heart of Coconut Grove is just over a mile away. I gave this hotel a 4, but that is because I reserve a 5 rating for truly exceptional hotel experiences. The next time I have a trip to Coral Gables and southern Miami, I will stay at the Hampton Inn Coconut Grove again. (CS)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location...poor cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: achomefront
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was close to everything. It has a warm, friendly and helpful staff. We even had left my sons shark tooth necklace behind and they kindly returned it after finding it. BUT the reason for my not so stellar review is one of the beds were not changed because we found another persons bodily hair all over it. Although they responded immediately and changed it the damage was done not to mention the beds were unforgiving, difficult to sleep in.. The bathroom had hair in crevices...it was dirty! The air conditioner was EXTREMELY loud. The Continental Breakfast was NOT the norm in other Hampton Inn locations. Cannot say I will stay there again. I would however like to give kudos to the staff, especially the front desk. They are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Clean Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: OhioHummel
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Miami on February 5th and every hotel we went to in Miami was over $200.00. and Parking additional. Other hotels was scary. We asked some police officers If they could recommend a hotel. They mentioned this hotel. We were so glad they did. It was safe, Clean, The room was wonderful. Parking included. Great staff ,they even had wine and some food for their guests as a courtesy. Great free breakfast also. We went peak time of year. It was 141.00 per night But well worth it. We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel if you have to stay in Miami and want to feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable for University of Miami parents”
Reviews.Author: jjett30169
Reviews.Content: The evening milk and cookies were so good after a long day of travel. Also enjoyed having snacks in my room. Breakfast was fabulous - fresh cut grapefruit, pineapple and oranges. No generic cereals or breads found on these premises! Saved time and money not having to go out for breakfast or snacks. The room was great - clean and comfortable. Front desk staff attentive to all my needs. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet in the area”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaParislover
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and pleant hotel. Location was great for conecting to highways and beach. Clean rooms, friendly staff and decent complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This isn't going to be a positive review”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I was charged for a stay at this hotel, and I didn't stay. What is worse, is that when I called the hotel after seeing the charge on my credit card they asked me if I had a cancellation number and declined to reverse the charge to my credit card when I said I did not. Let me explain. I booked a room here for one night to arrive on November 10. I had my meeting pushed back a couple of days so I changed the reservation to November 12 instead. When I arrived at the hotel on the 12th it was about 50/50 as to whether my meeting would be canceled or not, so rather than check in I decided to work in the lobby. I received a call that my meeting was canceled so I packed up my laptop and headed for the airport. On my way out the door I stopped at the front desk and told the clerk that I would not need my room and would not be checking in. I got on a plane and returned home. A couple of weeks later while doing my company expenses I noticed that I had been charged for the room on my Amex bill. There had been a couple of times in the past when I had forgotten to cancel my room by mistake at other hotels when business plans had changed last minute and in every case I was able to call the hotel, apologize, and have the charge reversed even though I had forgotten. In this case I called the hotel and spoke to the Front Desk Manager and explained what had happened. The Manager asked me if I had a cancellation number and refused to reverse the charge without one. When I called the Hilton family Guest Services Line they looked up the activity on this stay and said that not only had the front desk clerk not canceled my reservation, she checked me into my room at 4:15 PM, about the same time I left for the airport. I have a call into the General Manager of the hotel and I hope the issue will be resolved in a satisfactory manner. I am a Hilton Diamond Preferred member (I travel too much and I try to stay at Hilton family properties when I do) and as a last resort the Guest Services Agent has promised me that I will get a credit on my Amex account if the hotel will not reverse the charge. My concern is that response I received from Ingrid the front desk manager is indicative of a bigger customer service problem with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: mharv
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights here and was not disappointed. There is free parking, the upper deck is outside and the lower deck is completely secure gated There is 24hr security throughout the hotel and the grounds, a security guard patrols the whole site The reception staff were very friendly and gave us a map of the local area and let us leave our suitcases in a secure room for the day They have complimentary coffee, hot choc, tea 24hrs, then throughout the day and evening there are lots of free snacks, beer, cookies, corn dogs etc. The breakfast is free and is OK too There is a business center where you can access the internet for free Its not a 5* hotel but its fine, only 15mins drive from Miami international and its one of very few hotels in Miami that has free parking Would I stay here again, most definitely

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nqfr
Reviews.Content: My fisrt stop for a Florida Tour with my family (2 kids). 10 Minutes of drive from the Airport and close to the Coconut Grove Area. Rooms are very clean. The staff is very nice and the breakfast fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good base for vizcaya and fairfield”
Reviews.Author: gwgMimsFlorida
Reviews.Content: As my wife puts it Hamptons are the bottom of luxury. Very clean, and comfortable beds, this hotel provided free off road parking in a garage, and had a hot outdoors jacuzzi with views of full moon. Usual plastic breakfast but a large breakfast room. We used as base for visiting Vizcaya and Fairfield Gardens and picking up family from Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend this one!”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: Although quite dated compared to a lot of hotels I was very pleased with this hotel. It has free car parking, very convenient location, lovely and helpful staff, free breakfast and evening reception. It was very clean and safe - I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hampton standards”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Hampton locations and have come to rely on their consistently high standards - unfortunately this property does not live up to them. Even though I had booked long in advance, rooms were badly assigned during check-in. Walls are paper-thin so you can hear every word from adjacent rooms. Rooms themselves are old but OK, though little care is taken of them (e.g. broken shower heads, large stains on the walls or carpet). The elevators are painfully slow, and one of the two was constantly broken during our stay without any sign of an attempt at repair. Service is strictly on a "try asking for it" basis; none of the personnel volunteered any information or help. Miami has many hotel options, and at this price point it sure has better ones.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: exumabahamas
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn in Coral Gables is great. They offer a free happy hour on Tues, Wed & Thurs. The complimentary breakfast was also a plus. The room was neat and clean. Front desk help was excellent. they gave us a higher floor so we could have a better view (didn't even ask). Close enough to the high end shopping, etc. in Coconut Grove and also Miami and South Beach. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me!”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: My daughter had work to do in Miami and wanted to take her young son so I agreed to go along and babysit. We spent several days at this property. We had a room with two double beds on the third floor. The room looked down on the parking lot and was the last room on the floor next to the housekeeping closet. I was impressed by the staff at the hotel. The cleaning crew was always kind and friendly. They honored the "Do Not Disturb" sign when I posted it on the door and were quick to move their cart out of the way when the baby and I needed to get down the hall with the stroller. The room itself was clean, but nothing spectacular--typical motel layout with a small circular table and two chairs and a long dresser with a desk and drawers. The television was a long wide screen flat panel which was nice. There was a tub with shower and the amenities were adequate. The bathroom was clean and the water pressure was good. The breakfast each morning was very good. They also had bags at the front desk for people on the go with a muffin, granola bar and bottle of water. The attendants in the breakfast area were very friendly and helped me since it was not easy to maneuver the stroller and get my food. They always had bagels, muffins, pastries, fruit, yogurt and cereals but the hot items alternated. One day there was Canadian bacon and another day there was sausage. The eggs were round disks that were not too appetizing but on the day they had tortillas there was an egg scramble that was quite tasty. There was coffee and juice. I found it to be a very clean area and always well-stocked. The attendants made sure that no one went without and more than once I saw them go to the back to get something at the request of a guest. They gave my grandson cookies one day that they retrieved from an area off of the kitchen. There was a small exercise room and I saw people there using the equipment. There was a pool and a hot tub area but I did not use it. I saw a family out there one afternoon. The hotel is not in an area that is especially pedestrian friendly. I had wanted to take a long walk with the baby in the stroller but I found that the sidewalks were not always continuous. One would travel along the front of an apartment complex for awhile and then suddenly the sidewalk would stop requiring one to push through gray sand and over gnarled roots or very close to the traffic. The hotel faces the back of a small strip shopping center. Inside that center is a Subway and a Dunkin Donuts, a pet store, and a few other businesses. There is also a Pollo Tropicale fast food place and a gas station with a bakery inside of it. There is a Burger King across a busy highway. Beside the hotel is a church with a school and on the other side of it is a place called Berries in the Grove. We ate almost all of our meals there. The food was very good. There is an interior patio so it is larger than it looks. On first glance I only thought it was a bar, but I found the food to be good and lots of families and children were there so they had high chairs and were receptive to the baby. If you are going to be in this area it is really good to have a car as there is not much to do within reasonable walking distance with children. The pedestrian difficulties made my stay there less than wonderul, but this was no fault of the hotel property. If you need a place on business I would think the Hampton would be ideal. The internet connectivity is free. There is no charge for parking. The hotel staff is great. Upon arrival we were tired and the front desk staff gave us menus to four places that provided free delivery to the hotel. The first place they recommended was closed (Basil closes at 5 p.m.) so we ended up ordering from Que Pizza. I would not recommend it. They delivered a pizza that was NOT what we ordered but by that time (45 minute delivery time) we were too hungry to protest. The pizza crust was baked apart from the topping and it was hard and tough and not at all tasty. We ended up picking most of the vegetables off of the hard round disk that was the crust and the cheese was not very good either. It was by far the worst meal of our stay--go to Pollo Tropicale or to Berries!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but 15 False Fire Alarms - Sunday Morning”
Reviews.Author: Jim_EastWest
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are great and the breakfast is good. In fact all was going well right until the fire alarm started to go crazy on Sunday morning. As a fire alarm should be - it was loud and high pitched. I guess after the first half dozen my patience grew thin but after a dozen or so I did indeed have a pretty severe headache. As there seemed no end to them we decided to leave the hotel early and when we got down in the lobby I discovered we were not the only complainers. After putting our cruise bound suitcases in the rental I returned to the desk and informed the clerk that I certainly was not 100% satisfied with my stay (thumping headache - forced to leave early , etc) and asked for a full refund per hotel policy. I was informed that the best the hotel could offer was a $40 discount on a $220 bill. I refused the discount and later in the day called Hampton Inn 800 number from the cruise ship before it departed to tell my saga to a supervisor. Much to my surprise the supervisor immediately agreed with me that I should receive a 100% refund and did not agree with the hotel that the fire alarm problem could be categorized as an "act of god". She informed me that the hotel would receive notification of my complaint and would be given a three day opportunity to refund the 1 day stay and failing that I would receive the refund directly from the corporate office. On my return from the cruise my credit card had been credited with the refund from the hotel. I guess the moral of the story is that if one does have a justified complaint about a stay at a hotel chain offering 100% guarantee don't be to fast to accept a minimal discount. If in doubt call corporate and tell them your yarn! - Please note - The hotel never once made any announcements regarding the false fire alarms which I found quite strange.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: jrfras
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I wanted a budget-conscious place where I could easily get to a conference in downtown Miami (10 - 15 minutes away) and enjoy South Beach (25 minutes away). The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the place was relatively quiet (except for the little barking dog somewhere in the neighborhood). There was a flat-screen, HD TV, a decent -sized refrigerator with a separate freezer section, and microwave in the room. The hotel had free WiFi and parking. The buffet breakfast was quite extensive, with not only the usual cereal and bread products, but eggs and sausage, and fresh fruit, too. There was even a complimentary happy hour with beer and snacks! My only complaints were that the towels weren't super soft and the water pressure in the shower on the 6th floor was lacking. I can deal with both of those for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cesarbm
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth trip to the Miami area and my first stay at a Hampton Inn. In my previous visits to Miami I had stay at South Beach/Downtown hotels, although I have nothing to complain about the downtown Hyatt or the (now extintct) Fontainebleau Hilton, after this recent experience I do prefer the Hampton Inn. The hotel is just next to US1, really convinient to get further south or up north, it is only a 5 minute drive to Coconut Grove. The staff is really firendly, from your arrival at the front desk, the servers at the continental breakfast, the maids, everyone is always happy to help. I got room 613, on the top floor, one king bed, 32" LCD TV, a mini fridge and microwave oven (that I did't use), spacious bathroom with shower (no tub), a mid size closet with in room safe (I understand that not all rooms have a safe). The view out the window is not great, but who travels to stay in the room looking out the window. The rate includes free self service parking, free continental breakfast, free high speed internet and free use of the busisness center, were they have two PC computers with laser printers. There is also an outdoor pool with a jacuzzi. What I liked most about the hotel, was the do it yourself concept. There is no bellboys or concierge, when you arrive you just get one of the carts and take your suitcases up to your room, also the free self service parking is a luxury in Miami very hard to find. The only con of the hotel is that the airconditioning is a little bit to noisy. If you like shopping you will find that the The Village of Merrick Park and the Shops at Sunset Place are close by as well as the Dadeland Mall and further south The Falls. The most complete mall I could say that is Aventura up north and Saw Grass Mills is one of the largest outlet malls in the US. If you like luxury shopping, don't miss Bal Harbour Shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: Nina8
Reviews.Content: We loved the flat screen TV!!!! It also had cables for a portable DVD player. The breakfast was nice. The room was spacious. Overall it was a quiet place. The staff were really nice. There is also a guest laundry which was helpful after a long trip. Not on the main thoroughfare, but was a 5-10 minute walk to the transit station. There were a few fast food places in the immediate area. The hotel provided a listing and map of the local restaurants. Beware, the walk from the train station to the Dadeland Mall was long. But the mall was relly nice. Also, this is not far from the main area of Coral Gables, a short taxi ride or 20 minute walk through the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: HavinFunInTheSunNJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 days in Miami prior to going on a cruise. We wanted a hotel that was reasonably priced, clean and close to the Miami tourist attractions. This hotet met all of those criteria and more. I did hours and hours of research trying to find a hotel in Miami. Finally I ran across this hotel and decided it looked like it would work for us. I was 100% right. Our stay was outstanding right from the beginning. We had stayed up late the night before and when our plane landed at 9:30am I called the hotel to see if we could get in our room early. They said our room was already ready. It was so great to check into our room early and take a nap before starting our sightseeing. The room was impeccably clean. Hampton Inn has very comfortable beds with really nice white comforters. We also had a big flat screen TV. The hotel has just about every extra you could want. It has a pool, hot tub and computers with internet access. Parking is free and we always got a close space. The neighboorhood seemed safe. There is a stop on the Miami's metro system a block away. The breakfast is free and has a different hot choice every day in addition to all the usual continental breakfast items like cereal, muffins, bagels, fruit, juices and coffee. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. Another thing I really liked was how easy it was to get where we wanted to go. It took about 15 minutes to get there from the airport. It's right off of US 1 which got us to downtown very quickly. The coconut grove and Miracle Mile shopping areas are each about 5 minutes away. It took us about 20 minutes to get to South Beach. Plenty of restaurants in the near vicinity. The hotel provided a very nice map with a list of all the places you might need in the area. I don't know why you would want to deal with the hassle of staying in any of the beach areas when you could stay here in a nice, clean hotel with great service and amenities. I would definitely stay here again if I went to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “They Want Your Business”
Reviews.Author: lisatravels
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the level of service at this hotel, particularly on week days when there were continous food offerings at the happy hour and at breakfast we were brought tiny boxes of mints and water bottles for our day. These were not offered on week-ends, though service was still good on those days and breakfast items were continuously replenished. We had wanted a hotel in South Beach, but ended up here because we didn't want to pay SB prices. We were very happy with the location as it is very near Coral Gables and Coconut Grove both with good restaurants. It was about twenty mintues from South Beach. Even though it is right off the highway, it is on a quiet street. Room was fairly large and clean. Hotel doesn't have great curb appeal, but inside is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: BTuba
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week over Easter with my family in a nice and clean room for four adults. We enjoyed our stay, in particular because of the nice and friendly staff. The complementary breakfast and a welcome reception was nice. The location was an excellent base for our sightseeing trips to the Everglades, the Keys, Key Biscaine and Miami South. One of the reasons why I chose this hotel was also the fact that car parking was free of charge. Last year I stayed in another hotel in the same street and payed 25 bucks per night only for parking.

Reviews.Title: “All that I asked for”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for the night of 14th March. We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport having flown in from the UK & for its nearness to US1 to travel onto the Keys. The hotel still has free parking & plenty of it. We checked in without any problems & took the lift to our 6th floor (top floor) room. I had requested a larger room on a higher floor away from any possible noise & this we were given & it was appreciated. Our room was very clean & of a good size with flat TV screen ,table & chairs & a floor to ceiling window with distant views over to Miami which was great. The bed was huge & very comfortable. The shower had good power & the bathroom was also very clean. The breakfast the following morning had an outstanding choice for a help yourself style & it was excellently presented. There was a large tv to watch the news if you wished & although the sound was turned up it was not too loud. A very smiley young lady came around to see if she could assist in any way & gave out bottles of water. She was a real credit to the hotel. We used the hotels business facilities & they were very good, 2 computers, printer & fax machine. We had booked in for 2 nights but decided to go down to The Keys a day earlier as storms were forcast for the Miami area. We spoke to the helpful young lady at reception & she offered to try to make a booking for us at Hampton Inn Islamorada.She was successful & we thanked her. I would happily return to this hotel. We did not go out looking for nearby restaurants/nightlife/shops so I can't personally comment but others have.The rate was very good & I get double-dipping.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Merkey
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Coconut Grove was exactly as what we expected from any other Hampton Inn - clean room with breakfast and parking included. There is a small pool looking out to the parking lot and a tiny jacuzzi. Overall our stay was pleasant and uneventful. The proximity to the Coconut Grove shops was a plus - just a short drive away - to a good selection of restaurants and stores. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute drive to Miami Beach without traffic and about a 20 minute drive to the airport. We stayed during the Christmas holidays so this hotel cost a lot more than what it would normally be - but this is a fair choice for a family visiting the area with a rental car. Not much nightlife around other than the Coconut Grove restaurants so if that's what you're looking for, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'_Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older than most Hamptons which we stay at every week all around Florida on business. We usually get a refrigerator if they don't supply them and we were shocked that they wanted $15 per day at this location. The usual price always had been $5 per day so they are ripping off their guests. And then some of the ice machines were out of order. One of the nicest things was that we could communicate in English with all of the staff we spoke with! They were very friendly and helpful. This is unusual for the Miami area. Coconut Grove is a very nice area with lots of things to do and great resturants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Extras for a Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: TrvlrX
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a great location for shoppers, business travelers or those in Miami to visit family. The rooms, beds, and baths are top-notch and clean. There is a small but very pleasant pool and well-equiped 24-hour work out room. There are free copies of the Miami Herald (Spanish and English versions) available in the lobby. So, if you desire something a little meatier than the USA Today, you are in business. Speaking of business, I used the business center and it had all you might need. The front desk staff was pleasant and helful too. I stayed in the hotel about 4 years ago and then again this month. On this trip, everything seemed fresher and newer than I remember from last time. It was perfectly fine before, but they are refining their act. Also -- The parking is secure and free. Rare for Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: big_bajan
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room in this hotel to attend the Bascom Palmer Eye Institute in Miami. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted and allowed to check in early. All the staff are really nice and everyone greets you with a smile and a hello. We know that most hotels offer a complimentary continental breakfast with cold pastries and what not. At Hampton, we had a hot breakfast with all the trimmings all complimentary! The location of the property is very central and the I-95 is right at the front step for a quick drive to shopping malls. The hotel has a business centre, gym, meeting room and a pool. What else do you need in a hotel? 10 points to all the staff! We will be sure to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly, and CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeClean!
Reviews.Content: I probably would have given these folks 5 stars if I had gotten my King room (w/micro and fridge) the first week. I hate it when you reserve well ahead of time, reserve it with your credit card and then it's magically unavailable when you show up. I guess they overbook just like the airlines...anyway, the first week's double bed room with obigatory small round table was basic with no fridge and micro for the same (competitive, admittedly) price. It was clean with a good size (clean) bathroom and the beds were comfy. The second week's King room added a microwave and fridge with a chair and footstool. Each room had a very usable desk and FREE high-speed internet. Both were clean and well-maintained with comfy beds. Everything worked properly except that the high speed internet was down twice during the second week. Problem was a corporate one, however, so I don't blame the hotel. Hotel parking is FREE (a major advantage in the Miami area). From about 5 till 8, there's a nightly wine and appetizer available in the lobby and the breakfast selection is above average for continental (includes both hot and cold). Good coffee selection and freshly brewed decaf during the evening hours is great, too. Staff is very friendly and personable. Very pleased with the gym - REAL fitness equipment including Lifecycle recumbent cycle, Hoist weights and Precor treadmill and elyptical. If you're tired of spending big bucks at the tourists/ restaurants try these: across the street is a chain (!) Pollo Tropical - it may be "fast food" but they use fresh ingredients and make really authentic-tasting Cuban food (try the pork sandwich - lean, great flavor and the Cuban bread is wonderful). Also, try Sergio's (on Coral )a few blocks from the hotel - very authentic and inexpensive (there are local maps available at the front desk). All in all, very pleased with my experience - Hamptons are consistently good and this one didn't disappoint. Congrats to the local staff!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: SLHGalen
Reviews.Content: While not in the "heart" of the beach areas, it's well-located, parking is free (trust me, that means something in this part of Florida) and the staff made our stay special. Travelling to Bascom-Palmer Eye Institute, this particular Hampton Inn was the best value, breakfast was decent, and it's located within half a block of some very excellent restaurants. Take a taxi to Cocowalk and avoid the traffic. We accidently left a prized toy belonging to my grandson there, and the staff found Elmo and had him mailed home almost before we got home.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: GlenRockNJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK but nothing more. It is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the free breakfast is nice. The pool, like many in Florida, is not heated and the water was too cold in January to use it. The pool is also smaller than it looks in their photos. Hampton is part of the Hilton chain but don't expect this hotel to be anywhere near that category. The area the hotel is located in is also just average - we felt safe walking to the convenience store across the street at night but the area does look a bit run down. We stayed here based on the previous reviews on this site and it was acceptable for one night but no more. If you're looking for a nice vacation spot for multiple nights this is not the place. Quite frankly, the previous reviews made this sound spectacular and it's not. We were actually disappointed when we saw it and considered changing hotels. But we were only there for one night so we stayed.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Miami-Coconut Grove/Coral Gables
HotelInfo.Address: 2800 Southwest 28th Terrace, Coconut Grove, Miami, FL 33133
